newsitem.title: USA: U.S West Coast refined prods prices flatten Friday.
newsitem.headline: U.S West Coast refined prods prices flatten Friday.

text.p: Wholesale prices for U.S. West Coast refined petroleum products were flat Friday as traders left the market early for the weekend, brokers said.
Activity was razor-thin, with the few remaining players sidelined due to volatile NYMEX market, which was sharply higher Friday.
"The MERC (New York Mercantile Exchange) one day is way up and the next day down," one broker said.
NYMEX July unleaded gasoline jump 1.12 cents a gallon on concerns that the delay of Iraqi oil into world markets would shrink supply.
Offers on Los Angeles CARB gasoline remained steady at 56.00 cents a gallon, traders said, with buyers at 55.00 cents.
Los Angeles CARB diesel, meanwhile, was flat at 57/58 cents a gallon.
